class.name: Array
class.description: Generic array, contains several elements of any type, accessible by numerical index starting at 0. Negative indices can be used to count from the right, like in Python. Arrays are always passed by reference.

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolColorArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolVector3Array].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolVector2Array].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolStringArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolRealArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolIntArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolByteArray].

method.name: append
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: back
method.description: Returns the last element of the array if the array is not empty (size>0).

method.name: bsearch
method.description: Finds the index of an existing value (or the insertion index that maintains sorting order, if the value is not yet present in the array) using binary search. Optionally, a before specifier can be passed. If false, the returned index comes after all existing entries of the value in the array. Note that calling bsearch on an unsorted array results in unexpected behavior.

method.name: bsearch_custom
method.description: Finds the index of an existing value (or the insertion index that maintains sorting order, if the value is not yet present in the array) using binary search and a custom comparison method. Optionally, a before specifier can be passed. If false, the returned index comes after all existing entries of the value in the array. The custom method receives two arguments (an element from the array and the value searched for) and must return true if the first argument is less than the second, and return false otherwise. Note that calling bsearch on an unsorted array results in unexpected behavior.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the array (resize to 0).

method.name: count
method.description: Return the amount of times an element is in the array.

method.name: duplicate
method.description: Returns a copy of this [code]Array[/code].

method.name: empty
method.description: Return true if the array is empty (size==0).

method.name: erase
method.description: Remove the first occurrence of a value from the array.

method.name: find
method.description: Searches the array for a value and returns its index or -1 if not found. Optionally, the initial search index can be passed.

method.name: find_last
method.description: Searches the array in reverse order for a value and returns its index or -1 if not found.

method.name: front
method.description: Returns the first element of the array if the array is not empty (size>0).

method.name: has
method.description: Return true if the array contains given value. [codeblock] [ "inside", 7 ].has("inside") == true [ "inside", 7 ].has("outside") == false [ "inside", 7 ].has(7) == true [ "inside", 7 ].has("7") == false [/codeblock]

method.name: hash
method.description: Return a hashed integer value representing the array contents.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: invert
method.description: Reverse the order of the elements in the array (so first element will now be the last) and return reference to the array.

method.name: pop_back
method.description: Remove the last element of the array.

method.name: pop_front
method.description: Remove the first element of the array.

method.name: push_back
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array.

method.name: push_front
method.description: Add an element at the beginning of the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Resize the array to contain a different number of elements. If the array size is smaller, elements are cleared, if bigger, new elements are Null.

method.name: rfind
method.description: Searches the array in reverse order. Optionally, a start search index can be passed. If negative, the start index is considered relative to the end of the array.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the amount of elements in the array.

method.name: sort
method.description: Sort the array using natural order and return reference to the array.

method.name: sort_custom
method.description:
Sort the array using a custom method and return reference to the array. The arguments are an object that holds the method and the name of such method. The custom method receives two arguments (a pair of elements from the array) and must return true if the first argument is less than the second, and return false otherwise. Note: you cannot randomize the return value as the heapsort algorithm expects a deterministic result. Doing so will result in unexpected behavior. [codeblock] class MyCustomSorter: static func sort(a, b): if a[0] < b[0]: return true return false
var my_items = [[5, "Potato"], [9, "Rice"], [4, "Tomato"]] my_items.sort_custom(MyCustomSorter, "sort") [/codeblock]
